subject: Re: [junit] Source of Junit
msgSnippet: To write Junit test case. should I understand all  source programs.
messageBody:
To write Junit test case. should I understand all source programs.




Ramya TV wrote:

> You could also open the jar file with Winzip.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Paul Michali [mailto:pcm@cisco.com]
> Sent: Thursday, September 06, 2001 4:27 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] Source of Junit
> Guillaume Forget wrote:
> >
> > HI,
> >
> > I would like to get the source of JUnit 3.7
> > Is there any better way to get the java files than using the csv system on
> > SourceForge
>
> Assuming you've installed JUnit on your system, in the JUnit3.7
> directory,
> there is a src.jar file (which is sorta like a TAR file, if you've
> worked
> with them). You can extract all the sources from that file using the jar
> program from a command line:
>
> jar -xf src.jar
>
